briefdescription.para: Compare two floats with absolute tolerance.
Dump a dense vector to stderr (debug helper).
Build a 4x4 dense matrix used for testing.

detaileddescription.para: This can be represented with two non-zero 2x2 blocks on the diagonal.

briefdescription.para: Build block-sparse descriptor for the 4x4 test matrix.

detaileddescription.para:
The layout is BSR with 2x2 blocks:
rows = 4, cols = 4
block_rows = 2, block_cols = 2
n_block_rows = 2, n_block_cols = 2
nnzb = 2 (two diagonal blocks)
Row pointers: row_ptr = [0, 1, 2] Column indices: col_idx = [0, 1] Values (two 2x2 blocks, row-major each): B0 = [1 2; 3 4] B1 = [5 6; 7 8]

parameterdescription.para: Descriptor to populate (must not be NULL).

briefdescription.para: Test helper functions for block grid sizes and density.
Test that init and release leave descriptor in a safe state.
Test GEMV on the 4x4 example with a simple vector.
Test that loader fails with a missing file.

detaileddescription.para: This just checks error handling and status codes.

briefdescription.para: Entry point: run all block-sparse tests.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero if any subtest fails.

briefdescription.para: Unit tests for block-sparse format helpers and GEMV kernel.
